* In February 2008, the Dominican Republic passed a law to facilitate the migration of all public entities (government, education, etc.) to Software Libre, and to adopt open standards in the public sector.<ref>[http://www.softwarelibre.cl/drupal//?q=node/1205/print Ley de Software Libre RepÃºblica Dominicana]</ref>
* In February 2008, the Dominican Republic passed a law to facilitate the migration of all public entities (government, education, etc.) to Software Libre, and to adopt open standards in the public sector.<ref>[http://www.softwarelibre.cl/drupal//?q=node/1205/print Ley de Software Libre RepÃºblica Dominicana]</ref>
* In April 2008, Ecuador passed a similar law, Decree 1014, designed to migrate the public sector to Software Libre.<ref>{{}es icon} [http://www.estebanmendieta.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/Decreto_1014_software_libre_Ecuador.pdf Estebanmendieta.com], Decree 1014</ref>
* In April 2008, Ecuador passed a similar law, Decree 1014, designed to migrate the public sector to Software Libre.<ref>{{}es icon} [http://www.estebanmendieta.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/Decreto_1014_software_libre_Ecuador.pdf Estebanmendieta.com], Decree 1014</ref>

* In March 2009, the French Gendarmerie Nationale announced it will totally switch to Ubuntu by 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://arstechnica.com/open-source/news/2009/03/french-police-saves-millions-of-euros-by-adopting-ubuntu.ars|title=Ars Technica - French police: we saved millions of euros by adopting Ubuntu}}</ref>
+
* In March 2009, the French Gendarmerie Nationale announced it will totally switch to [[Ubuntu (operating system)!Ubuntu]] by 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://arstechnica.com/open-source/news/2009/03/french-police-saves-millions-of-euros-by-adopting-ubuntu.ars|title=Ars Technica - French police: we saved millions of euros by adopting Ubuntu}}</ref>
